info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 2 at 8:45PM MST until July 2 at 11:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa.
* WHEN...Until 1145 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hassayampa River, Star Wash, Wagner Wash, Centennial Wash, Fourmile Wash, Beer Bottle Wash, Gila River, Corgett Wash, Mill Wash, Trilby Wash, Winters Wash, Beardsley Canal, Jackrabbit Wash, Daggs Wash, Agua Fria River, Dickey Wash and Coyote Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Glendale, Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Sun City West, Litchfield Park, White Tank Mountain Park, Perryville, Liberty, Luke AFB and Surprise Stadium. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MST THIS EVENING
